Comment: Putin doesn't believe Ukraine is a real country. He invaded because he wants his legacy to be a restoration of the former Russian Empire.  Blaming it on anything else is feeding right into his hands.  “Putin doesn't believe Ukraine is a real country.”  By that he means a homogenous state with a single identity, he made that known back in 2008 ‘Ukraine is not even a state! What is Ukraine? A part of its territory is in Eastern Europe, but another part, a considerable one, was a gift from us!” Here he’s referring to the Southeastern parts where the conflict is raging that have more Russian speakers/ethnic Russians.  Which in the early 1920s Lenin arbitrarily allocated those lands from Russia to Ukraine, Putin spoke about this in 2018 and how it planted a time bomb in the Soviet state and laid the foundation for the ongoing crisis.  https://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/jan/25/vladmir-putin-accuses-lenin-of-placing-a-time-bomb-under-russia   https://gulfnews.com/amp/story/world%2Feurope%2Fputin-denounces-soviet-founder-lenin-1.1660012   https://www.americanrhetoric.com/speeches/vladimirputindonbassandukraine.htm  Western media likes to interpret things like this in a narrow-minded way to fit their narrative/agenda, admittedly he probably should’ve made it more clear that he meant Ukraine as a state with a unified national identity.  “He invaded because he wants his legacy to be a restoration of the former Russian Empire.”  Please provide the quote where he says he wants his legacy to be the restoration of the Russian Empire.   “Blaming it on anything else is feeding right into his hands.”  By ignoring the contents of the text of the cable I quoted in my original comment you’re excusing the role played by the West in fueling this crisis. You’re also deliberately trying to narrow the conversation because you seemingly don’t want to entertain an opposing point of view.  Whether you like it or not, this issue is extremely complex and nuanced, not black & white and Western media attempting to paint it as such makes them extremely disingenuous and duplicitous.
